channel.title: Hashmap on Hashnopolis
channel.description: Recent content in Hashmap on Hashnopolis

item.title: 1. Two Sum
item.description: Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. Example: Given nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9, Because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9, return [0, 1]. Solution: # time: o(n) # space: o(n) class Solution: def twoSum(self, nums, target): """ :type nums: List[int] :type target: int :rtype: List[int] """ res = [-1, -1] if nums == None or len(nums) < 2: return res solutionMap = {} for pos in range(len(nums) - 1): if (target - nums[pos]) in solutionMap: res[0] = solutionMap[target - nums[pos]] res[1] = pos break solutionMap[nums[pos]] = pos return res
